name: present_value
parameter: Present value of lifetime benefits from a year of deworming — in terms of increases in ln(consumption) — DtW
notes:
GiveWell assumes a value of 0.21, which includes an adjustment for benefits decaying over time and a household multiplier. To be conservative, we use 0.115, before these 2 adjustments, taking roughly half the impact on consumption. We assumed 4% discounting of consumption. 

Some kids reached through NDD from age 1-19 will be the same YoY, so this calculation assumes a linear dose-response relationship. This might be too strong and we may modify this later after further review. We may take a similar approach to GiveWell's CEA adjusting for a 10% decay over time in the impact.

name: takeup
notes: GiveWell analyzed coverage figures and found that Government reported deworming coverage represents about 80% of all eligible children; and when audited the number of students dewormed was actually roughly about 73% coverage of all eligible children. Because of this, we adjust government reported figures by 0.73/0.8=0.9125.

name: unit_cost
parameter: Unit cost per child per year (India)
notes: We use an estimate of the unit cost per year (both rounds) in India in 2020. This may be revised later as we get better information.
